headline.main: Ex-Soviet Astronaut Sees Need for a Space Shuttle

results.snippet: The Soviet space program must develop a low-cost transport vehicle like the American space shuttle Columbia, a former Russian astronaut says.   The statement yesterday in Pravda, the Communist Party newspaper, by Konstantin P. Feoktistov, one of...
results.lead_paragraph: The Soviet space program must develop a low-cost transport vehicle like the American space shuttle Columbia, a former Russian astronaut says. The statement yesterday in Pravda, the Communist Party newspaper, by Konstantin P. Feoktistov, one of three crewmen who orbited the earth 16 times aboard Vostok 1 in 1964, was the first official acknowledgment by a Soviet official that the Russians would like to have a shuttle for manned space flights.
